FunctionsÂ¶

Functions in Illumina is just like functions from most programming languages. After being defined, it can be invoked with a (possibly empty) list of parameters, and will return an value (unless the return type is void).

Function definitions cannot be nested, and must be defined at the outmost scope (directly inside the file) or inside a class definition. The basic syntax of a function is:

func funcName :: ReturnType (param :: ParamType):
    functionBody;

  • funcName: the name of the function

  • ReturnType: the return type of the function

  • param: the name of the parameter

  • ParamType: the type of the parameter

  • functionBody: a code block containing the body of the function

The parameter list is delimited with commas ,; each parameter declaration has a similar format with variable declaration. Note that unlike some languages, a default value cannot be assigned to a parameter; overloading should be used instead.
